did.unittitle: Leon Davis Classroom Presentation Audio-Visual Materials, 1976
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Audio of Leon Davis's presentation during George Brook's class in the Spring of 1976.

bioghist.p: Leon J. Davis (1906-1992), was a Polish-born U.S. labor leader. In 1932 he founded Local 1199 of the Drug, Hospital and Health Care Employees Union. He was head of the the union for fifty years, building it into a powerful national and progressive force.

scopecontent.p: Audio of Leon Davis's presentation during George Brook's class in the Spring of 1976.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Leon Davis Classroom Presentation Audio-Visual Materials #/4038 AV. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
